terms.name: TSH
terms.description: Thyroid-Stimulating Hormone (TSH) regulates the production of thyroid hormones.
terms.explanation: TSH is like the gas pedal for your thyroid gland, telling it when to release hormones for energy and metabolism.

terms.name: Hemoglobin
terms.description: A protein in red blood cells that carries oxygen throughout the body.
terms.explanation: Think of hemoglobin as a bus that carries oxygen passengers to different parts of your body.

terms.name: White Blood Cells (WBC)
terms.description: Cells that help fight infections and protect against diseases.
terms.explanation: WBCs are like the bodyâ€™s soldiers, fighting off invaders like bacteria and viruses.

questions.question: What is TSH?
questions.answer: TSH stands for Thyroid-Stimulating Hormone, which regulates thyroid function.

questions.question: Why is hemoglobin important?
questions.answer: Hemoglobin carries oxygen in your blood to all parts of your body.

questions.question: What happens if WBC count is high?
questions.answer: A high WBC count might indicate an infection or inflammation in your body.
